review: Its products like Fire TV Stick that continually set Amazon above other retailers (If you can limit Amazon to a retailer).  Typical Amazon excessive user-friendly(ness).  I'm confident even the most non-technical user could be up and running with this in minutes.  I have Chromecast as well but based on a friends recommendation I decided to pick up the Fire TV Stick and I'm glad I did.  I didn't realize Fire TV Stick worked with so many service providers (Netflix, Hulu etc) so that was a nice surprise.  Everything is centrally located on a clean, responsive interface.  Even the remote app for the iPhone works great.  Fire TV Stick, as with most Amazon products, exceeded my expectations and I will be sending a dozen of these as gifts to my family.
author: JP

author: Amazon Customer

review: I good stick for streaming content, however I don't like that it forced me to plug into an actual outlet because it wasn't receiving enough power via the USB. There is lots of "content" available via Amazon, but a lot of it that they are advertising at "top, new, popular" are obscure / not current / not that great in regards movies. A lot of content that is current / popular / well received is available to stream but is not included in Prime and you must purchase, which begs the question, "what am I actually getting of quality viewing with my Prime membership?" Content wise I'm on the fence, product wise (the stick itself) it seems pretty capable and easy to use.
author: E. Preston
